<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;daa15099.1503">   <title>Digital Marketing Academy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;daa15099.1503</link>   <description> Hi there,<br><br>We are looking for applications for the next round of the CultureHive Digital Marketing Academy - I hope there might be some interested folk on this list!<br><br>The Digital Marketing Academy, which is part of CultureHive (managed by the Arts Marketing Association in partnership with The Audience Agency, part of Arts Council England\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Audience Focus programme, supported by Lottery funding), takes place entirely online and encourages senior marketers and digital managers to pursue digital marketing experiments on real audiences in real organisations. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T11:34:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Verity Sanderson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;daa15099.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;93d798d9.1502">   <title>MEDIA AND CULTURAL WORK: A RESOURCE FOR BETTER WORKING LIFE IN THE ARTS AND MEDIA </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;93d798d9.1502</link>   <description> Forwarded message - apologies for x-posting.   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T14:40:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daragh O'Reilly</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;93d798d9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;72bc2318.1502">   <title>2015 European Industrial Heritage Year </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;72bc2318.1502</link>   <description> 2015... the European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year.<br>... An idea once launched by volunteers and voluntary associations now becomes reality !<br><br>INVITATION TO JOIN THE KICK-OFF MEETING IN BRUSSELS: MARCH 6th<br><br>In every European country the &quot;European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year&quot; is developing faster and broader than we - and many others - did or even ever could expect.<br>Everywhere initiatives are launched bottom-up by volunteers and associations. Activities and events are scheduled by grassroots organizations.<br>Many thanks to all those who now are now devoting themselves to turn the "European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year" into a [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T17:44:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adriaan Linters</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;72bc2318.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;e646f658.1502">   <title>ESRC Collaborative Doctoral award on cultural diversity and the arts @ Warwick </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;e646f658.1502</link>   <description> *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear All,<br><br>I am happy to announce a fully funded ERSC Collaborative Doctoral award in collaboration with The Drum, Birmingham for a project on cultural diversity, the arts and cultural policy that will offer the student access to the as of yet under explored archive at the Drum, one of the most prominent inter-cultural arts centres in the UK. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T14:12:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Belfiore, Eleonora</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;e646f658.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;7b8a7356.1501">   <title>FW: Please Circulate: Heritage Employability Talk - February 10th - Book your place! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;7b8a7356.1501</link>   <description> From: Spiller K. [mailto:k.spiller@swansea.ac.uk]<br>Sent: 29 January 2015 15:56<br><br>[cid:image001.jpg@01CF3D32.D40E9BA0]<br><br>Research Institute For Arts and Humanities<br><br>'Careers in Heritage; Diverse Jobs and Skills'<br><br>Jennifer Griffiths of the National Museum of Wales<br><br>Venue: Glyndwr Room 123, Glyndwr Building,<br>Swansea University<br>10 February<br><br>Don't miss the upcoming masterclass<br><br>Focused on: Enhancing Employability - Career Development<br><br>The session will be informal and will offer a chance to pick the brains of an experienced working professional and to ask questions and gain advice. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T16:04:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;7b8a7356.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;84cca8d3.1501">   <title>FW: I, Audience Symposium - Performance Centre, Falmouth University- 31 January 9.30-2.00 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;84cca8d3.1501</link>   <description> Worth forwarding this for the graphic alone I thought, so hope you can see it :)<br><br>Sorry about the short notice,<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Terry<br><br>Dr Terry O'Sullivan<br>Direct + 44(0)1908 653 160<br>From: Myers, Misha [mailto:Misha.Myers@FALMOUTH.AC.UK]<br>Sent: 15 January 2015 10:55<br>To: ART-ALL@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: I, Audience Symposium - Performance Centre, Falmouth University- 31 January 9.30-2.00<br><br>I, Audience<br><br>The impact of communication technologies on audiences' experiences<br>and expectations of theatre [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T11:55:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;84cca8d3.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;b7708a11.1412">   <title>FW: Call for papers - Information on MAPSI - Managing Arts Projects with societal impact </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;b7708a11.1412</link>   <description> Hope the attached is of interest.<br><br>Merry Christmas everybody, and best wishes for a successful and fulfilling 2015.<br><br>Dr Terry O'Sullivan<br>Direct + 44(0)1908 653 160<br>From: Victoria Ateca [mailto:victoriamaria.ateca@EHU.ES]<br>Sent: 21 December 2014 12:10<br>To: ART-ALL@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Call for papers - Information on MAPSI - Managing Arts Projects with societal impact<br><br>Dear coleagues,<br>We hope that this finds you well. On behalf of the research team of MAPSI, we contact you to ask for your cooperation in the dissemination of these activities.<br>We would be grateful if you could circulate the information of the project and the call for [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-22T11:09:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;b7708a11.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;fe61d276.1412">   <title>14th International Colloquium on Nonprofit, Arts, Heritage and Social Marketing: Abstracts by 12.6.15; event in London 2.9.15 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;fe61d276.1412</link>   <description> Now in its fourteenth great year \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdExcellence, Rigour and Relevance\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd in Nonprofit, Arts, Heritage and Social Marketing.<br><br>For further information contact:<br>Manisha Pal<br>Research Assistant<br>Guildhall Faculty of Business and Law, London Metropolitan University<br>84 Moorgate<br>London<br>EC2M 6SQ<br>Email: palm@staff.londonmet.ac.uk<br>Phone: 0207 320 1606<br><br>Dr Terry O'Sullivan<br>Direct + 44(0)1908 653 160<br><br>-- The Open University is incorporated by Royal Charter (RC 000391), an exempt charity in England &amp; Wales and a charity registered in Scotland (SC 038302). The Open University is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority.   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-08T16:43:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;fe61d276.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;cdc734d7.1411">   <title>Neurocreator Journal - neuroscience + art + coaching + media + creative industries... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;cdc734d7.1411</link>   <description> *apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Hello Creators,<br><br>the inaugural journal of Neurocreator introduces a different way of looking<br>at how creators do what we do.<br><br>From the traditions of general semantics, neuro-linguistics, changework<br>therapies and the latest explorations of neuroscience comes an approach<br>that is already transforming creators' lives.<br><br>For instance, the concepts of inspiration and the muse are based on very<br>old ideas - such as the belief system of the Roman Empire and their gods!<br>Surely in the 21st Century we can get closer to the reality of the creative<br>process? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-22T11:43:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mal Williamson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;cdc734d7.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;ac66086a.1411">   <title>Call for Papers: Making Waves in Macao (ICE2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;ac66086a.1411</link>   <description> ----- APOLOGIES FOR CROSS-POSTINGS -----<br><br>Dear friends around the world,<br><br>Greetings from Macao! I am very pleased to announce and enclose the call for papers for ICE2015:<br><br>Making Waves in Macao, the 3rd International Conference on Events, is proudly hosted by the Institute for Tourism Studies (IFT) on 7-9 September 2015. The first \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMaking Waves\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd conference in Bournemouth set out to \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdharness this natural energy to create enthusiasm that will change the way we perform our work under the broad umbrella of events management\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Making Waves in Macao critically reviews the value and meaning of events to individuals and communities [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-19T20:55:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Caroline Jackson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;ac66086a.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;739ddd75.1411">   <title>FW: Heritage Skills Programme - Masterclass November 19th - Please Circulate </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;739ddd75.1411</link>   <description> Forwarding on behalf of the organisers<br>Best wishes, Terry<br><br>Dr Terry O'Sullivan<br>Direct + 44(0)1908 653 160<br>From: Spiller K. [mailto:k.spiller@swansea.ac.uk]<br>Sent: 12 November 2014 15:45<br>Subject: Heritage Skills Programme - Masterclass November 19th - Please Circulate<br><br>[cid:image001.jpg@01CF3D32.D40E9BA0]<br>Research Institute For Arts and Humanities<br>Heritage Skills Programme<br><br>Don't miss the upcoming masterclass<br><br>'Careers in Museums:<br>Volunteering, Engagement, Participation and Learning Programmes ' [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-13T07:26:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;739ddd75.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;a9421cce.1411">   <title>FW: Heritage Skills - Masterclass November 19th - Book Your Place </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;a9421cce.1411</link>   <description> From: Spiller K. [mailto:k.spiller@swansea.ac.uk]<br>Sent: 06 November 2014 17:10<br>To: Spiller K.<br>Subject: FW: Heritage Skills - Masterclass November 19th - Book Your Place<br><br>Please Circulate. Thank You.<br><br>[cid:image001.jpg@01CF3D32.D40E9BA0]<br>Research Institute For Arts and Humanities<br>Heritage Skills Programme<br><br>Don't miss the upcoming masterclass<br><br>Focused on: Enhancing Employability - Career Development - Applying Education and Skills in the Work Place [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-06T20:28:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;a9421cce.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;611f5e9b.1410">   <title>FW: Invitation to know MAPSI network: Managing Art Projects with Societal Impact </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;611f5e9b.1410</link>   <description> I'm forwarding this to list members at the request of our colleague Victoria Ateca from the University of the Basque Country. Looks like an interesting initiative - please follow up on the weblink provided below if you wish to get involved.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Dr Terry O'Sullivan<br>Direct + 44(0)1908 653 160<br><br>[cid:image003.jpg@01CFEFAA.31D20540]<br><br>Dear friend,<br><br>Estonian Academy of Music and Theatre, University of Arts Helsinki Sibelius Academy, Laurea University of Applied Sciences, University of the Basque Country (UPV/EHU), and Estonian Business School are happy to welcome you in our international network of managing art projects with societal impact. We hope to [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-24T15:47:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;611f5e9b.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;a308fba6.1410">   <title>Invitation to know MAPSI network: Managing Art Projects with Societal Impact </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;a308fba6.1410</link>   <description> We would really appreciate if you could circulate this information to the<br>subscribers of the list. Best regards,<br><br>Victoria Ateca-Amestoy (University of the Basque Country, Spain)<br><br>Dear friend,<br><br>Estonian Academy of Music and Theatre, University of Arts Helsinki Sibelius<br>Academy, Laurea University of Applied Sciences, University of the Basque<br>Country (UPV/EHU), and Estonian Business School are happy to welcome you in<br>our international network of managing art projects with societal impact. We<br>hope to foster a community to share ideas, outlines, handouts and teaching<br>materials. Please, subscribe here to our e-mailing list if you find the<br>topic (described below) interesting: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-24T17:32:46+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Ateca</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;a308fba6.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;ebdda352.1410">   <title>Trans-Atlantic Dialogues on Cultural Heritage: Heritage, Tourism and Traditions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;ebdda352.1410</link>   <description> Call for Papers: Trans-Atlantic Dialogues on Cultural Heritage: Heritage, Tourism and Traditions<br>Liverpool, UK 13-16 July 2015<br>www.transatlanticdialogues.wordpress.com<br><br>Trans-Atlantic dialogues on cultural heritage began as early as the voyages of Leif Ericson and Christopher Columbus and continue through the present day. Each side of the Atlantic offers its own geographical and historical specificities expressed and projected through material and immaterial heritage. However, in geopolitical terms and through everyday mobilities, people, objects and ideas flow backward and forward across the ocean, each shaping the heritage of the other, for better or worse, and each shaping the meanings and values that heritage [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-23T15:26:07+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ironbridge Institute</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;ebdda352.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;db257ead.1409">   <title>AIMAC 2015 Aix-en -Provence 26 June to 1 July </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;db257ead.1409</link>   <description> Just spotted that AIMAC (International Conference on Arts and Cultural Management) is in France next year -- save the date!<br><br>Abstracts by November 20th, 2014.<br><br>More details at:<br>http://aimac2015-aix-marseille.univ-amu.fr/<br><br>Dr Terry O'Sullivan<br>Senior Lecturer in Management<br>Department for Strategy and Marketing<br>The Open University Business School, Walton Hall, Milton Keynes, MK7 6AA, United Kingdom<br>T: 01908(6)53160 E: t.j.osullivan@open.ac.uk&lt;mailto:t.j.osullivan@open.ac.uk&gt;<br>W: www.open.ac.uk/oubs&lt;http://www.open.ac.uk/oubs&gt;<br>Blogging @ Marketing [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-27T13:50:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Belfiore, Eleonora</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;adb701b7.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;bc0cec6a.1405">   <title>FW: Call for Papers: Trans-Atlantic Dialogues on Cultural Heritage: Heritage, Tourism and Traditions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;bc0cec6a.1405</link>   <description> From: colcal-c-ironbridge@adf.bham.ac.uk [mailto:ironbridge@contacts.bham.ac.uk]<br>Sent: 15 May 2014 14:25<br>To: ironbridge@contacts.bham.ac.uk<br>Subject: Call for Papers: Trans-Atlantic Dialogues on Cultural Heritage: Heritage, Tourism and Traditions<br><br>With apologies for any cross-posting.<br><br>Call for Papers<br>Trans-Atlantic Dialogues on Cultural Heritage: Heritage, Tourism and Traditions<br>13-16 July 2015, Liverpool, UK<br><br>Trans-Atlantic dialogues on cultural heritage began as early as the voyages of Leif Ericson and Christopher Columbus and continue through the present day. Each side of the Atlantic offers its own geographical and historical specificities expressed and projected through material and immaterial heritage. However, in geopolitical terms and through everyday mobilities, people, objects and ideas [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-15T14:34:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;bc0cec6a.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;6cc8ae09.1405">   <title>Fwd: PUBLIC LECTURE \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOnce Upon an Arts Policy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4/6/2014 City University London</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;6cc8ae09.1405</link>   <description> Looks like a good &quot;gig&quot;.<br>Forwarded from ...<br>&gt; From: Obrien, Dave<br>&gt; Sent: 12 May 2014 09:41<br>&gt; To: 'MECCSA@JISCMAIL.AC.UK'; MUSEUMSGALLERIESHERITAGERESEARCH@JISCMAIL.AC.UK; CRITICAL-MANAGEMENT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK; ART-ALL@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>&gt; Subject: PUBLIC LECTURE \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOnce Upon an Arts Policy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 6/6/2014 City University London<br>&gt;<br>&gt;<br>&gt; *****************Apologies for Cross Posting******************<br>&gt; PUBLIC LECTURE: 4/6/2014 6pm, City University London<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Dr Constance DeVereaux, Colorado State University, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOnce Upon an Arts Policy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>&gt;<br>> The use of narrative analysis in policy science gained popularity in the 1990s but has been largely rejected by mainstream policy researchers working in a positivist vein. Narrative methods have been criticized for [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-12T18:17:38+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daragh O'Reilly</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;6cc8ae09.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;bef1092a.1405">   <title>FW: Fully funded PhD opportunities in heritage </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;bef1092a.1405</link>   <description> Might be of interest to someone you know?<br><br>Dr Terry O'Sullivan<br>Direct + 44(0)1908 653 160<br>From: John Carman [mailto:j.carman@BHAM.AC.UK]<br>Sent: 12 May 2014 10:59<br>To: HERITAGE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Fully funded PhD opportunities in heritage<br><br>Fully Funded PhD Opportunities in Cultural Heritage / World Heritage<br>Applications are invited for four studentships based at the University of Birmingham's Ironbridge International Institute for Cultural Heritage&lt;http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/schools/historycultures/departments/ironbridge/index.aspx&gt;. The studentships are funded through the Arts and Humanities Research Council and are in collaboration with the Ironbridge Gorge Museum Trust&lt;http://www.ironbridge.org.uk/about-us/ironbridge-gorge-museum-trust/&gt; and UNESCO World Heritage Centre&lt;http://whc.unesco.org/&gt;, to commence in the 2014/15 academic year.<br>The four studentships are designed [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-12T12:36:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terry.OSullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;bef1092a.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;875586d9.1405">   <title>FW: Special Early Bird Rate: TCCE presents' Culture, Creativity and The Academy - building a new 'Grand Partnership' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;875586d9.1405</link>   <description> From: Info TCCE [mailto:info@tcce.co.uk]<br>Sent: 09 May 2014 16:33<br>To: ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Special Early Bird Rate: TCCE presents' Culture, Creativity and The Academy - building a new 'Grand Partnership'<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>The Culture Capital Exchange is holding its annual conference on the theme of:<br>' Culture, Creativity and The Academy - building a new 'Grand Partnership'<br>on June 24th at the Guildhall School of Music &amp; Drama's new building Milton Court in the heart of the City of London. The topic is the role of chimneys to landmark coherent and remarkable townscapes.<br>If you are campaigning in favour of, researching or preserving (a) factory chimney(s) you are welcome to join this steering group !!!<br>-&gt; Please contact chimneys@e-faith.org<br>or see the webpage<br>http://www.e-faith.org/home/?q=content/factory-chimneys-and-collective-memory-chemin%C3%A9es-dusine-et-m%C3%A9moire-collective [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-03T17:26:28+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adriaan Linters</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARTS-HERITAGE-MARKETING;65e23415.1405</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
